medical_history.chief_complaint: Localized abdominal pain in the right lower quadrant (RLQ) associated with nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior with vague abdominal pain that later localized to the RLQ. The patient has associated nausea but denies vomiting. No significant changes in pain intensity were noted, and the patient was still tolerating a diet.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Allergic rhinitis, chronic kidney disease, Insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (IDDM), erectile dysfunction, gastroesophageal reflux, glaucoma, gout, hyperparathyroidism, hypertension, knee pain, leg cramps, monoclonal gammopathy, retinal detachment, selective IgA immunodeficiency, sleep apnea, vitamin D deficiency, retinal branch artery occlusion, lower back pain, colonic adenoma, childhood asthma.
medical_history.family_history: Plasma cell myeloma and alcohol abuse.
